00055 /*
00056  * 1cf6
00057  * lcfG
00058  */
00059 #define LUSTRE_CFG_VERSION 0x1cf60001
00060 #define LUSTRE_CFG_MAX_BUFCOUNT 8
00061 
00062 #define LCFG_HDR_SIZE(count) \
00063     cfs_size_round(offsetof (struct lustre_cfg, lcfg_buflens[(count)]))
00064 
00069 #define LCFG_REQUIRED         0x0001000
00070 
00071 enum lcfg_command_type {
00072         LCFG_ATTACH             = 0x00cf001, 
00073         LCFG_DETACH             = 0x00cf002, 
00074         LCFG_SETUP              = 0x00cf003, 
00075         LCFG_CLEANUP            = 0x00cf004, 
00076         LCFG_ADD_UUID           = 0x00cf005, 
00077         LCFG_DEL_UUID           = 0x00cf006,

00086         LCFG_PARAM              = 0x00cf00f, 
00087         LCFG_MARKER             = 0x00cf010,

00089         LCFG_LOG_END            = 0x00ce012, 
00090         LCFG_LOV_ADD_INA        = 0x00ce013, 
00091         LCFG_ADD_MDC            = 0x00cf014, 
00092         LCFG_DEL_MDC            = 0x00cf015, 
00093         LCFG_SPTLRPC_CONF       = 0x00ce016, 
00094         LCFG_POOL_NEW           = 0x00ce020, 
00095         LCFG_POOL_ADD           = 0x00ce021, 
00096         LCFG_POOL_REM           = 0x00ce022,

00098         LCFG_SET_LDLM_TIMEOUT   = 0x00ce030, 
00099         LCFG_PRE_CLEANUP        = 0x00cf031, 
00101         LCFG_SET_PARAM          = 0x00ce032,

00110         LCFG_NODEMAP_DEL_GIDMAP = 0x00ce047, 
00111         LCFG_NODEMAP_ACTIVATE   = 0x00ce048, 
00112         LCFG_NODEMAP_ADMIN      = 0x00ce049, 
00113         LCFG_NODEMAP_TRUSTED    = 0x00ce050,

00116         LCFG_NODEMAP_ADD_SHKEY  = 0x00ce053, 
00117         LCFG_NODEMAP_DEL_SHKEY  = 0x00ce054, 
00118         LCFG_NODEMAP_TEST_NID   = 0x00ce055, 
00119         LCFG_NODEMAP_TEST_ID    = 0x00ce056, 
00120 };

00122 struct lustre_cfg_bufs {
00123         void    *lcfg_buf[LUSTRE_CFG_MAX_BUFCOUNT];
00124         __u32    lcfg_buflen[LUSTRE_CFG_MAX_BUFCOUNT];
00125         __u32    lcfg_bufcount;
00126 };
00127 
00128 struct lustre_cfg {
00129         __u32 lcfg_version;
00130         __u32 lcfg_command;
00131 
00132         __u32 lcfg_num;
00133         __u32 lcfg_flags;
00134         __u64 lcfg_nid;
00135         __u32 lcfg_nal;         /* not used any more */
00136 
00137         __u32 lcfg_bufcount;
00138         __u32 lcfg_buflens[0];
00139 };
00140 
00141 enum cfg_record_type {
00142         PORTALS_CFG_TYPE = 1,
00143         LUSTRE_CFG_TYPE = 123,
00144 };
00145 
00146 #define LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, idx)            \
00147         ((lcfg)->lcfg_bufcount <= (idx)         \
00148          ? 0                                    \
00149          : (lcfg)->lcfg_buflens[(idx)])
00150 
00151 static inline void lustre_cfg_bufs_set(struct lustre_cfg_bufs *bufs,
00152                                        __u32                   index,
00153                                        void                   *buf,
00154                                        __u32                   buflen)
00155 {
00156         if (index >= LUSTRE_CFG_MAX_BUFCOUNT)
00157                 return;
00158         if (bufs == NULL)
00159                 return;
00160 
00161         if (bufs->lcfg_bufcount <= index)
00162                 bufs->lcfg_bufcount = index + 1;
00163 
00164         bufs->lcfg_buf[index]    = buf;
00165         bufs->lcfg_buflen[index] = buflen;
00166 }
00167 
00168 static inline void lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(struct lustre_cfg_bufs *bufs,
00169                                               __u32 index,
00170                                               char *str)
00171 {
00172         lustre_cfg_bufs_set(bufs, index, str, str ? strlen(str) + 1 : 0);
00173 }
00174 
00175 static inline void lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(struct lustre_cfg_bufs *bufs, char *name)
00176 {
00177         memset((bufs), 0, sizeof(*bufs));
00178         if (name)
00179                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 0, name);
00180 }
00181 
00182 static inline void *lustre_cfg_buf(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg, __u32 index)
00183 {
00184         __u32 i;
00185         size_t offset;
00186         __u32 bufcount;
00187         LASSERT (lcfg != NULL);
00188 
00189         bufcount = lcfg->lcfg_bufcount;
00190         if (index >= bufcount)
00191                 return NULL;
00192 
00193         offset = LCFG_HDR_SIZE(lcfg->lcfg_bufcount);
00194         for (i = 0; i < index; i++)
00195                 offset += cfs_size_round(lcfg->lcfg_buflens[i]);
00196         return (char *)lcfg + offset;
00197 }
00198 
00199 static inline void lustre_cfg_bufs_init(struct lustre_cfg_bufs *bufs,
00200                                         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00201 {
00202         __u32 i;
00203         bufs->lcfg_bufcount = lcfg->lcfg_bufcount;
00204         for (i = 0; i < bufs->lcfg_bufcount; i++) {
00205                 bufs->lcfg_buflen[i] = lcfg->lcfg_buflens[i];
00206                 bufs->lcfg_buf[i] = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, i);
00207         }
00208 }
00209 
00210 static inline char *lustre_cfg_string(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg, __u32 index)
00211 {
00212         char *s;
00213 
00214         if (lcfg->lcfg_buflens[index] == 0)
00215                 return NULL;
00216 
00217         s = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, index);
00218         if (s == NULL)
00219                 return NULL;
00220 
00221         /*
00222          * make sure it's NULL terminated, even if this kills a char
00223          * of data.  Try to use the padding first though.
00224          */
00225         if (s[lcfg->lcfg_buflens[index] - 1] != '\0') {
00226                 size_t last = cfs_size_round(lcfg->lcfg_buflens[index]) - 1;
00227                 char lost;
00228 
00229                 /* Use the smaller value */
00230                 if (last > lcfg->lcfg_buflens[index])
00231                         last = lcfg->lcfg_buflens[index];
00232 
00233                 lost = s[last];
00234                 s[last] = '\0';
00235                 if (lost != '\0') {
00236                         CWARN("Truncated buf %d to '%s' (lost '%c'...)\n",
00237                               index, s, lost);
00238                 }
00239         }
00240         return s;
00241 }
00242 
00243 static inline __u32 lustre_cfg_len(__u32 bufcount, __u32 *buflens)
00244 {
00245         __u32 i;
00246         __u32 len;
00247         ENTRY;
00248 
00249         len = LCFG_HDR_SIZE(bufcount);
00250         for (i = 0; i < bufcount; i++)
00251                 len += cfs_size_round(buflens[i]);
00252 
00253         RETURN(cfs_size_round(len));
00254 }
00255 
00256 static inline void lustre_cfg_init(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg, int cmd,
00257                                    struct lustre_cfg_bufs *bufs)
00258 {
00259         char *ptr;
00260         __u32 i;
00261 
00262         lcfg->lcfg_version = LUSTRE_CFG_VERSION;
00263         lcfg->lcfg_command = cmd;
00264         lcfg->lcfg_bufcount = bufs->lcfg_bufcount;
00265 
00266         ptr = (char *)lcfg + LCFG_HDR_SIZE(lcfg->lcfg_bufcount);
00267         for (i = 0; i < lcfg->lcfg_bufcount; i++) {
00268                 lcfg->lcfg_buflens[i] = bufs->lcfg_buflen[i];
00269                 LOGL((char *)bufs->lcfg_buf[i], bufs->lcfg_buflen[i], ptr);
00270         }
00271 }
00272 
00273 static inline struct lustre_cfg *lustre_cfg_new(int cmd,
00274                                                 struct lustre_cfg_bufs *bufs)
00275 {
00276         struct lustre_cfg       *lcfg;
00277 
00278 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00279         OBD_ALLOC(lcfg, lustre_cfg_len(bufs->lcfg_bufcount, bufs->lcfg_buflen));
00280 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00281         lcfg = malloc(lustre_cfg_len(bufs->lcfg_bufcount, bufs->lcfg_buflen));
00282 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00283 
00284         if (lcfg != NULL)
00285                 lustre_cfg_init(lcfg, cmd, bufs);
00286 
00287         return lcfg;
00288 }
00289 
00290 static inline void lustre_cfg_free(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00291 {
00292 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00293         OBD_FREE(lcfg, lustre_cfg_len(lcfg->lcfg_bufcount, lcfg->lcfg_buflens));
00294 #else /* ! __KERNEL__ */
00295         free(lcfg);
00296 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00297 }
00298 
00299 static inline int lustre_cfg_sanity_check(void *buf, size_t len)
00300 {
00301         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg = (struct lustre_cfg *)buf;
00302         ENTRY;
00303         if (!lcfg)
00304                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00305 
00306         /* check that the first bits of the struct are valid */
00307         if (len < LCFG_HDR_SIZE(0))
00308                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00309 
00310         if (lcfg->lcfg_version != LUSTRE_CFG_VERSION)
00311                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00312 
00313         if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount >= LUSTRE_CFG_MAX_BUFCOUNT)
00314                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00315 
00316         /* check that the buflens are valid */
00317         if (len < LCFG_HDR_SIZE(lcfg->lcfg_bufcount))
00318                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00319 
00320         /* make sure all the pointers point inside the data */
00321         if (len < lustre_cfg_len(lcfg->lcfg_bufcount, lcfg->lcfg_buflens))
00322                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00323 
00324         RETURN(0);
00325 }
00326 
00329 #endif /* _LUSTRE_CFG_H */
